quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Usa and Group
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, people, size. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What Woody Allen movie depicts a future with robot butlers?
What was in total eclipse according to Bonnie Tylers 1983 hit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The heart

questions.question: What group was popular in the 1960s with the hits Yummy Yummy Yummy and Chewy Chewy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Ohio Express

questions.question: What disease do the following famous people share: Menachem Begin, Halle Berry, Carol Channing, Miles Davis, Ella Fitzgerald, Ray Kroc, Arthur Ashe, and Ty Cobb?
Nixon received a higher percentage of the popular vote during his losing bid for the presidency than when he won in 1968.
Which two of these musicians were born in Lafayette, Indiana?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Axl Rose and Shannon Hoon

questions.question: Which list is in increasing order regarding size?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Squad, Platoon, Company, Brigade

questions.question: The USA is divided into states. England is divided into counties. Which country is divided into departments?
Which 1955 movie won four Academy Awards?
In the 1995 movie Mr. Hollands Opus, Mr. Holland teaches young Gertrude Lang to play the clarinet piece Stranger on the Shore. Who wrote this famous piece?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Acker Bilk

questions.question: What nations gas group, PEMEX, made headlines in 1974?
Which actress and dancer appeared in Bon Jovis video Always?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Keri Russell

questions.question: In 1920 Edward P. Eddie Eagan won the first Olympic boxing gold medal for the USA. In 1932, he won a second gold Olympic medal in which sport?

Which state is famous for being the site of a series of major earthquakes in 1811 and 1812?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Madrid, Missouri

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Countries and Country

What TV cat had the motto I hate meeces to pieces?

questions.question: This country is not a federal republic.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Personal computers

questions.question: In three of these countries corruption is widely spread. Which is the odd country?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hannibal Hamlin

questions.question: Christianity is not the main religion in this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sri Lanka

questions.question: What future senator was the first Ph.D. on the moon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harrison H. Schmitt

questions.question: In Malawi, Nigeria and Botswana, the official language is this.

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Diamond and Earth
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, john, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The original name of the Beatles song, Eleanor Rigby, was Miss Daisy Hawkins.
What did the US government buy for the Native Alaskans in 1891?

options.text: The basis of their caribou herd

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The basis of their caribou herd

questions.question: In order for a natural diamond to form, it must be exposed to what specific conditions?

options.text: High pressure and absence of light
Comparatively low pressure and high temperature
High pressure and comparatively low temperature

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: High pressure and comparatively low temperature

questions.question: Travis Metcalfe, an astronomer at the Harvard-Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics, has presented a fascinating theory: he believes the largest diamond known is located where?

options.text: At the bottom of the Mariana Trench

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In a near star’s core

questions.question: What physical property of the diamond do carats measure?
On the sitcom Third Rock  from the Sun, John Lithgow plays Dick Solomon. What is his occupation on Earth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Professor of Physics

questions.question: Diamonds’ properties are commonly measured by the so called “four Cs.” What do the four Cs stand for?

options.text: Chemical balance, color, clarity and carat

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carat, clarity, color, and cut

questions.question: The word diamond comes from the ancient Greek word “adamas” meaning what translated in English?
Alaska, Texas and California are the three largest states in the USA. Which are the next two largest states?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Montana and New Mexico

questions.question: The diamond is the hardest known natural material on Earth.
In 1992 there was a petition signed by 30,000 people to change the name of Maui, Hawaii to Gilligan.
Diamond formation is a very slow process. It is estimated that most diamonds found in nature are of what approximate age?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1 – 3 billion years old

questions.question: About half of the 26,000 kg diamonds mined annually originate from which continent?
Although seemingly different, the diamond and the graphite are both allotropes of one and the same chemical element. Which one?
Which of these musicians was not among the first class inducted into the Jazz Hall of Fame?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ray Charles

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Word and Police
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, harris, fiction. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: When did Russia declare war against Japan during World  War II?

options.text: Two days after the bombing of Hiroshima
The day after the Battle of Kursk
The day after the Battle of Stalingrad

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Two days after the bombing of Hiroshima

questions.question: How were the dimensions of American battleships determined?

options.text: They had to be lower than the Golden Gates bridge and small enough to go through the Panama Canal.
They had to be large enough to carry the minimum of 278 people but small enough to go through the Suez Canal.
They had to be less than 111 feet tall and less than 11 feet wide.
They had to be lower than the Brooklyn Bridge and small enough to go through the Panama  Canal.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They had to be lower than the Brooklyn Bridge and small enough to go through the Panama  Canal.

questions.question: Thomas Harris created this terrible fictional murderer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hannibal Lecter

questions.question: In the 1994 film, Pulp Fiction, these actors portray Jules Winfield and Vincent  Vega.

options.text: Samuel L. Jackson and John Travolta
Ving Rhames and Samuel L. Jackson

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Samuel L. Jackson and John Travolta

questions.question: Which famous writer is not paired with the correct pseudonym?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ellery Queen-Erle Stanley Gardner

questions.question: The first US police force to buy a police car was also the first to have a police motorcycle squad.
As a protest to the British Tea Tax, colonial Americans used this for making tea.
How many continents are owned by only one nation?
What was the first rock group to play at New Yorks Carnegie Hall?

options.text: The French Ministry of Foreign Affairs

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The French Ministry of Foreign Affairs

questions.question: Which US President signed the law, which established the Congressional Medal of Honor - the highest military decoration awarded by the United States?
Who was the first woman to have a gold record?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Judy Garland

questions.question: The moves in this sport include Barani, Triffus, Miller, and Randy.
This word can mean a social upstart or a social climber.
What does the Hindu word Krishna mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: dark or dark blue

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Bride and Groom
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, jethro, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The kiss at the end of the wedding ceremony expresses a Christian belief and symbolizes the swapping of souls between the bride and the groom.
The wedding cake originated in ancient Rome where it was thrown at the bride or broken over her head as a sign of fertility.
What did Jethro Tull invent in 1701, while he was living in Crowmarsh Gifford, a village in Oxfordshire, England?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The seed drill

questions.question: Which of these was introduced in Britain by Lady Mary Wortley, who was a prolific writer of diaries, essays and poems?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Smallpox innoculation

questions.question: This island was originally called Van Diemens Land in honor of Anthony van Diemen.
The custom of all bridesmaids dressing alike was started to ensure that bride would stand out and be the center of attention on the alter.
This book, which bears the printed date 11th May 868, is known as the oldest-dated printed book.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Diamond Sutra scroll

questions.question: The tradition of proposing with a diamond engagement ring can be dated back to 1477 when the Archduke Maximilian of Hamburg gave one to Mary of Burgundy.
This person, who was High King of Ireland from 1002 to 1014, is popular as the ruler who managed to unify the regional leaders of Ireland, in order to free the land from Danish occupation.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brian Boru

questions.question: After three unsuccessful runs, this socialist was elected President in 1970.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Salvador Allende

questions.question: At weddings it is common for people to toast the bride or groom. The term toast originates from Italy where it was common to place a piece of bread in the bottom of a wine cup for flavor.
The tradition of placing the wedding ring on the third finger of the left hand originates from ancient Egypt, where they believed that a vein in this finger ran directly to the heart.
This statesman, born in Houghton Hall, Norfolk in 1676, is generally regarded as the first Prime Minister of Great Britain.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Walpole

questions.question: The tradition of the white wedding dress dates back hundreds of years. It was worn to symbolize the virginity of the bride.
In Anglo-Saxon times the bride stood on the left of the groom to allow him to keep his right sword hand free so that he could fight off anyone trying to kidnap the bride.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lucian Freud

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Diana Rigg

What is the more common name for the superfood Vaccinium oxycoccos?
